column5: From Scientific American: Personal Grooming Products May Be Harming Great Lakes Marine Life  http://www.scientificamerican.com/article.cfm?id=microplastic-pollution-in-the-great-lakes&WT.mc_id=SA_Facebook

Ya, wouldn't surprise me.  Like a lot of other junk we we ram into the dumps like swiffers, facial cloths, handi wipes, etc, for the lazy sake of convenience.  Drugs that we consume and expel that go to the local sewage treatment but can't be filtered out.  Plastic by the thousands of tonnes that litter nature.  It's endless.
